 a file irrespective of its contents without revealing the contents.

 not been

 make a 'digital hash' of the files contents. This renders a long hexadecim=
al
number which is reasonably unique and will change if the file or file co=
ntents are changed.
=C2=A0
The experimenter can then take a picture for exa=
mple, create the MD5 hash and send that
hash out as proof of the file's con=
tents, without revealing the picture content in this case.
=C2=A0
Later, on=
ce the picture is posted, anyone can run a similar hashing program against =
the
file to confirm they have the same file whose hash was posted by the ex=
perimenter 
originally. Hence you know what you see is a valid copy of the =
original (picture in this case).

 browse button to open a file on your
